attributes.action: Ban parliament holding another EU referendum. The votes were fair.
attributes.additional_details: The petition in question by the remain campaign is The petition, set up by William Oliver Healey, whicj states: “We the undersigned call upon HM government to implement a rule that if the remain or leave vote is less than 60% based on a turnout less than 75%, there should be another referendum.” it is not fair to hold another vote? Wasting more time and money that could be spent on more important things such as the nhs. The leave campaign voters have won the right for Britain to leave the EU.
attributes.background: There is another petition claiming a million signatorys want to the British parliament to hold another EU referendum, because they are upset that they didn't get there own way. The votes were cast' and the great British public voted in favour of leaving the EU. There is no need for another vote.
